Title: [10] Biofuel blends above B30 need MPA approval in Singapore
Excerpt: Singapore's Maritime and Port Authority (MPA) has introduced new regulations requiring vessels using biofuel blends exceeding B30 to obtain prior approval.
Content: Singapore's Maritime and Port Authority (MPA) has introduced new regulations requiring vessels using biofuel blends exceeding B30 to obtain prior approval. The measure aims to ensure safety and compatibility standards as the maritime industry transitions toward sustainable fuel alternatives. B30 refers to a blend containing 30% biofuel and 70% conventional marine fuel. Operators seeking to use higher biofuel concentrations must now demonstrate their vessels' technical readiness and compliance with international standards. The policy reflects Singapore's commitment to decarbonizing its shipping sector while maintaining operational safety across one of the world's busiest ports.
